CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 21, 1959, pg. 26 reads: "Yea, Westinghouse - "The House Doesn't Move!" That rousing cheer was heard throughout the stands of South Stadium recently as Westinghouse High School, for the sixth straight year, didn't move as they won the city football championship.  To lead the cheering Westinghouse spectators were the "House's" cheerleaders.  From left to right, front row: Beverly Wall, Barbara Harrison, Belva Stewart, Ruby Brown, "Peppy, the Bulldog," "Prince" (dog), Sarah Smith and Jean Blackwell.  Second row: Brenda Hartsfield, Ann Flemming, Doris Wilson, Sandy Stone, Priscilla Stanton and Bee Ford. - Harris Photo." From left to right, starting in back row:  Brenda Hardy (or Hartsfield), Margaret (or Ann Fleming), Lois Wilson, Sandra Stone, Priscilla Stanton, Beatrice Ford.  Front row: Beverly Wahl, Barbara Harrison Calloway, Belva Stuart, Ruby Brown, Sandy Bell (or Maxine or Nikki Claybrook), Sarah Smith Crable, Genie Blackwell
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Westinghouse High School cheerleaders with Prince the mascot dog, front row, left to right; front row: Beverly Wall, Barbara Harrison (Calloway), Belva Stewart, Ruby Brown, "Peppy" the Bulldog [Sandy Bell (or Maxine or Nikki Claybrook)], Sarah Smith (Crable), and Jean Blackwell; back row: Brenda Hartsfield, Ann Flemming (Beulford), Doris Wilson, Sandra Stone, Priscilla Stanton, and Beatrice Ford
